description:
The software described here allows packages to define reference
classes that behave in the style of <U+201C>OOP<U+201D> languages such as Java and
C++.
This model for OOP differs from the functional model implemented by S4
(and S3) classes and methods, in which methods are defined for generic
functions.
Methods for reference classes are <U+201C>encapsulated<U+201D> in the class definition.
